intro: Elateriopsis spectabilis, commonly known as the showy elaterion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and are arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Elateriopsis spectabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
